verses.verse: In the year <S%H8141><s%> that Tartan <S%H8661><s%> came <S%H935><s%> to Ashdod, <S%H795><s%> when Sargon <S%H5623><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%> sent <S%H7971><s%> him, <S%H3898><s%> and he fought against Ashdod <S%H795><s%> and took it; <S%H3920><s%>

at that time <S%H6256><s%> Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> by <S%H3027><s%> Isaiah <S%H3470><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Amoz, <S%H531><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> "Go, <S%H3212><s%> and loosen <S%H6605><s%> the sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> from off your waist, <S%H4975><s%> and take your shoes <S%H5275><s%> from off <S%H2502><s%> your feet. <S%H7272><s%>" He did so, <S%H6213><s%> walking <S%H1980><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> and barefoot. <S%H3182><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "As my servant <S%H5650><s%> Isaiah <S%H3470><s%> has walked <S%H1980><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> and barefoot <S%H3182><s%> three <S%H7969><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> for a sign <S%H226><s%> and a wonder <S%H4159><s%> concerning Egypt <S%H4714><s%> and concerning Ethiopia, <S%H3568><s%>

so the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria <S%H804><s%> will lead away <S%H5090><s%> the captives <S%H7628><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> and the exiles <S%H1546><s%> of Ethiopia, <S%H3568><s%> young <S%H5288><s%> and old, <S%H2205><s%> naked <S%H6174><s%> and barefoot, <S%H3182><s%> and with buttocks <S%H8357><s%> uncovered, <S%H2834><s%> to the shame <S%H6172><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>
They will be dismayed <S%H2865><s%> and confounded, <S%H954><s%> because of Ethiopia <S%H3568><s%> their expectation, <S%H4007><s%> and of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> their glory. <S%H8597><s%>

The inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of this coast land <S%H339><s%> will say <S%H559><s%> in that day, <S%H3117><s%> <S%H3541><s%> 'Behold, this is our expectation, <S%H4007><s%> where we fled <S%H5127><s%> for help <S%H5833><s%> to be delivered <S%H5337><s%> from <S%H6440><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> of Assyria. <S%H804><s%> And we, <S%H4422><s%> how will we escape?'"
